articles.author: Laila Bassam, Emily Rose, Simon Lewis
articles.description: Israel believes its air strike on Beirut killed a senior commander of Lebanese armed group Hezbollah on Tuesday, Israel's public broadcaster said, in retaliation for a cross-border rocket attack that killed 12 youngsters three days ago.
articles.title: Israel believes Hezbollah senior commander killed in Beirut strike, Israeli media report says

articles.author: Deisy Buitrago, Mayela Armas
articles.description: Protests by ruling party and opposition supporters are expected to take place in Venezuela on Tuesday in the wake of a disputed election victory by President Nicolas Maduro, with the opposition saying vote tallies show its candidate easily won.
articles.title: Venezuela ruling party, opposition rally supporters in election dispute

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Nandita Bose
articles.description: Vice President Kamala Harris will announce her vice presidential pick as early as Monday before embarking on a multi-state battleground tour with her new running mate later in the week, two sources familiar with the planning said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Harris to announce VP as early as Monday before embarking on battleground tour

articles.author: Chris Thomas, Munsif Vengattil, Jose Devasia
articles.description: At least 23 people were killed and scores injured after landslides in the hills of India's southern Kerala state, authorities said, with rescue operations were hampered after a main bridge collapsed in the region.
articles.title: Kerala's Wayanad landslide: At least 23 dead, more rain predicted

articles.author: Andrew Osborn
articles.description: A number of Russian dissidents and people convicted for their opposition to Moscow's war in Ukraine have disappeared from Russian prisons in recent days, in what rights activists say is a possible sign that a prisoner swap with the West may be close.
articles.title: Russian dissidents disappear from prison in sign a prisoner swap with the West may be close

articles.author: Bo Erickson
articles.description: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris held a marginal one-percentage-point lead over Republican Donald Trump in a new Reuters/Ipsos poll, closing the gap that opened in the final weeks of President Joe Biden's reelection bid.
articles.title: Harris, Trump locked in tight US presidential race, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem
articles.description: Thousands of Palestinians returned to their homes in the ruins of Gaza's main southern city Khan Younis on Tuesday, after Israeli forces ended a week-long incursion there which they said aimed to prevent Islamist armed group Hamas from regrouping.
articles.title: Israeli forces quit east Khan Younis, Palestinians recover dozens of bodies

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Blasts inside a base used by Iraq's Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF), an official state security agency containing several Iran-aligned armed groups, south of Baghdad on Tuesday killed three member and wounded four others, police and medical sources told Reuters on Tuesday.
articles.title: Blasts at Iraq PMF security agency base south of Baghdad kill 3 members, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Over 4,000 homes in North Korea's city of Sinuiju and Uiju County near the border with China have been flooded due to heavy rainfall, state media KCNA said on Wednesday.
articles.title: North Korea says thousands of homes hit by flooding

articles.author: Rich Mckay
articles.description: The largest wildfire in the U.S. swelled to over 600 square miles on Tuesday, bigger than the city of Los Angeles, fire officials in California said, as thousands of firefighters battled the blaze in a wilderness area north of Sacramento.
articles.title: Raging California wildfire grows bigger than city of Los Angeles
